DOC.brief_summary: The investigator hypothesize complementary intracoronary streptokinase administration primary percutaneous intervention patient acute myocardial infarction may provide limitation infarct size improvement leave ventricular volume function acute late phase ( 6 month ) .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Adjunctive Intracoronary Streptokinase Late Term Left Ventricular Infarct Size Volumes Patients With Acute Myocardial Infarction
DOC.criteria: Continuous chest pain last > 30 minute within precede 12 hour STsegment elevation least 1 mm 2 contiguous lead ECG Infarct related artery ( IRA ) occlusion ( TIMI grade 0 ) angiography Contraindications streptokinase , tirofiban , aspirin , clopidogrel , heparin Culprit lesion saphenous vein graft TIMI grade IIIII flow IRA Additional epicardial stenosis IRA distal stented segment ( significant insignificant ) Presence leave bundle branch block History prior MI
